subject: Law
title: Mass Incarceration in America
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mass Incarceration in America.

hook.text: The US has 4% of the world's population but 20% of its prisoners. No other democracy comes close.

buildup.text: The prison population exploded from 300,000 in 1980 to over 2 million by 2020, driven by tough-on-crime policies.

discovery.text: The War on Drugs, mandatory minimums, and three-strikes laws were the primary engines of mass incarceration.

twist.text: Black Americans are incarcerated at five times the rate of white Americans for similar offenses.

climax.text: Bipartisan reform is emerging. The First Step Act (2018) reduced some federal sentences and expanded early release.

punchline.text: A system that locks up millions isn't protecting society. It's defining it.

quiz.question: What share of the world's prisoners are in US facilities?
